awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  SenixBand - Remote Independent-Living Monitor and Frailty Status Tracker for Older Adults
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will revolutionize the way older adults who live independently at home are monitored. According to the American Association of Retired Persons (AARP), nearly 90% of older adults (age 65 and above) prefer to stay independently at their homes, coining the term "ageing in place". The proposed monitoring system monitors older adults in real time for changes in physical activity, falls, and loss of balance. These parameters can indicate changes in frailness in older adults which if addressed early can extend their period of independent living. The system will monitor blood pressure, heart rate, heart rate variability, and common cardiac conditions that often accompany loss of balance or falls, which can trigger early and more informed intervention that will allow issues to be addressed before a more serious injury occurs due to a fall. Current industry solutions rely on reactively initiating assistance after a fall is detected, which are usually too late to reverse the age-related deterioration and are ineffective at extending independent living. Ability of living independently longer for older adults will translate into significant savings in cost of care and will also improve their wellbeing.

The proposed project will develop an end-to-end monitoring systems for older adults living independently at home consisting of: 1) Development of a small wearable device for measurement of Heart Rate, Pulse Oximetry, Blood Pressure, and ECG; 2) Development of activity monitoring system and classification of activities that can be used in tracking frailty of a monitored older adult. Changes in frailty can be observed remotely, allowing for early intervention and potentially the ability to reverse physical or mental degradation. In addition, the system can assist in the decision when the older adults need a full-time caregiver to remain at home, which is difficult and usually preceded by some serious accident or medical emergency, such as a fall resulting in hospitalization or a serious illness. Such delayed decision can have serious life-threatening consequences.  The advancements will be made in activity monitoring, non-invasive continuous blood pressure monitoring to track changes in blood pressure, and integration of anomaly detection into ECG waveform analysis to provide additional information when loss of balance or fall occurs. Such real time monitoring will tax the battery of the wearable device and will be addressed by exploring anomaly-based energy management to prolong battery life.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
We know how nerve-racking it can be to experience a fall, especially when help is a long way away. A single fall can impact our lives, affect our self-confidence, and possibly cause life-threatening injuries. Whether you or your loved one has experienced a fall before or not, falls and loss of balance can induce chronic stress and mental fatigue. Nearly 1 in 4 Americans experience a fall each year, with over 2.8 million injuries treated in ER annually. To add to these staggering statistics, over 800,000 hospitalizations and more than 27,000 deaths each year can be attributed to falls alone. In many cases, falls in older adults can be attributed to increasing frailty that is not detected and addressed through early intervention. Frailty and resulting falls are serious problems in older adults and are especially relevant for those wanting to ?age in place.? ?Age in place? is a term used to describe older adults living independently in their homes. Older adults overwhelmingly prefer such arrangements as they are familiar and comfortable in their own homes. Moving to a more assisted living environment is perceived as a loss of independence and is opposed by older adults unless they are forced to by a fall, causing severe injury or severe frailty progression. Subsequently, many older adults are living alone as long as they can in their homes.

 

Biosenix LLC has developed SenixCare, a remote monitoring system, for older adults living independently at home. SenixCare mitigates risk, cost, and degradation of the quality of life for older adults living independently at home by non-obtrusive sophisticated monitoring of mobility, falls, and basic vital signs. In case of falls, SenixCare offers automatic 911 dispatch if falls are detected, potentially saving lives in case of dangerous falls. Monitoring basic activities of older adults such as the amount of sleep, rest, and active time is a good indicator of the frailty changes. SenixCare ecosystem provides older adults with the comfort of getting help if needed and allows for remote monitoring by caregivers. Caregivers can view current health status and are alerted in case of falls. They can also track long-term changes in activities indicating changes in frailty levels. Monitoring basic vital signs also provides 911 responders with additional contexts in an emergency and allows for better medical response.

 

SenixCare offers all of those features in a small wrist-worn band, providing continuous 24/7 monitoring. Biosenix achieved high accuracy for fall detection, activity monitoring, and vital sign monitoring by developing sophisticated algorithms tailored for older adults. A targeted approach focusing on older adults resulted in significant improvement in fall detection accuracy, reducing the burden of 911 dispatch monitoring by outside agencies ? this reduced operating costs and frequency of calls to validate that a fall happened. Integrated ECG and blood pressure monitoring provide insight into cardiac health for older adults. This can provide additional context when a fall occurs, enabling medical personnel to diagnose the cause of a fall more effectively and create a response plan.

 

Biosenix successfully developed the SenixCare system that is affordable and tailored towards features desired by older adults, caregivers, and physicians. The SenixCare system prolongs safe, independent living for older adults reducing care costs and improving the physical and mental wellbeing of older adults. Integrated monitoring provides a much better solution in the market at a lower price, making it affordable and a more acceptable solution for continuous wear and monitoring.
